subsection_content:
Chlamydia is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by the bacteria chlamydia trachomatis. The disease tends to increase worldwide. The United States alone has nearly 3 million people infected with Chlamydia every year, most commonly between 14 and 24 years old. (first)
Chlamydia occurs in both men and women. Men can get Chlamydia in the urethra (inside the penis), rectum, or throat. Women with Chlamydia infection in the cervix, rectum, or throat. Chlamydia is not difficult to treat, however, if not detected and examined promptly, the disease can cause serious complications.
subsection_data:
benh chlamydia.json. What is Chlamydia?
Chlamydia is a sexually transmitted infection (STI) caused by the bacteria chlamydia trachomatis. The disease tends to increase worldwide. The United States alone has nearly 3 million people infected with Chlamydia every year, most commonly between 14 and 24 years old. (first)
Chlamydia occurs in both men and women. Men can get Chlamydia in the urethra (inside the penis), rectum, or throat. Women with Chlamydia infection in the cervix, rectum, or throat. Chlamydia is not difficult to treat, however, if not detected and examined promptly, the disease can cause serious complications.
